item.title: The Long-Tail Problem: Where Relational Databases Start to Creak
item.description: Why Relational Databases Struggle with Long-Tail Data? Most systems have a few popular records that get accessed all the time — and millions of others that are rarely touched. This pattern is called the long tail. Popularity │\ │ | │ | │ |____________________ │ └───────────────────────────────▶ Head (popular) Tail (rare) Relational databases (like MySQL or PostgreSQL) use B-tree indexes to find rows quickly. They work great when most queries hit the same small set of data — the “head.
